div.h2: Values and Beliefs of Paradigm Schools

div.p: We serve the soul of the scholar
through study of classics.

div.h3: We believe in an absolute Truth. The aim of education is to discover Truth so that we can be truly free. The role of a Mentor at Paradigm is to guide scholars to discover Truth.

div.p: Learning in an environment of growth.

Founded on the pillars of wisdom, virtue, and relevance, our vision is to support families in educating their students by providing a classical, liberal arts, leadership education. We inspire learning through mentoring, discussion, service, developing critical thinking, fostering a constructive culture, and by applying the great ideas found in original works and other classics.

section.class: vw-widget-wrap vw-our-students vw-bg-color-5 vw-py-50 vw-py-xxl-70 clearfix

div.p: I love being a scholar at Paradigm. Through my years of study, my eyes have been opened to my potential, and my ability to take my education into my own hands. My experiences at Paradigm have taught me how to form opinions on subjects that are truly important to me, as well as examine ideas with multiple perspectives. The environment is very personal and all of my mentors know me, and my goals well, and I have made many precious friends and memories because of the familiar surroundings. Paradigm has taught me a lot, and I love this school.

Going to school at Paradigm has encouraged me to act mindfully, with the Principles of Liberty and Responsibility. It has taught me that if I have the discipline to work hard, I am the Master of my Fate. It has shown me the humanity and greatness in myself, and in everyone around me.

Paradigm has made me look at education in a way I never thought was possible, and showed me bonds between other scholars/mentors I never thought was possible. I feel confident now in my abilities in discussions, reading, writing, and expressing the importance of our history to new generations. I know this will take me farther in life than any other school could've taught me. We may be small, but we are powerful.

div.p: “Paradigm is the perfect balance for our growing scholars. It has allowed us to still be part of our homeschool community while simultaneously bringing great books and additional classes taught in an inspirational way. They support me and create a unique education that mirrors the desire for our youth to dig deep and grow in their abilities and talents. We love Paradigm!”

“I went to Paradigm all through high school. Best experience ever. Not only did it help me focus on my strengths, but it also prepared me for college with its challenging curriculum that makes you think outside the box. The mentors there care about each of their students individually, and want nothing more than the students’ success.”
div.h6: Jennifer Campanile Law, Paradigm Graduate, Class of 2015

div.p: “I’ve never known a school so dedicated to the mission of education that it is willing to change and grow to fit the needs of the students. It’s an inspiring place that has transformed lives, mine included, inspiring us to think for ourselves and strive for our inner greatness. Paradigm alumni here of 2013 and still thanking this school every day.”
div.h6: Serisa Woodruff, Paradigm Graduate, Class of 2013

div.p: “I love Paradigm. My children have never been happier, and have found a love of learning that was missing in their previous education!”
div.h6: Julia Holt, Former Paradigm Mentor and Parent

div.p: "I have officially had my first few days of teaching College Biology Labs at UVU. I should give it more time, but after comparing the students in beginning college classes to Paradigm scholars, I must say.... I am even more impressed with Paradigm than I have been in the past! I have noticed after grading the first assignment that these students are there for the grade and not to learn. I love the way Paradigm teaches how to think and not what to think. I will do my best in influencing these beginners to help them be more like Paradigm."
